title: LeaverBuster - Time for an upgrade
body:
**Hello all**
Have you ever been disconnected from a game due to:
- Bugsplat causing an error in the game
- "Firewall issues" connecting to the game, but you can still connect to the rest of the internet
- Other types of unexplained errors connecting to a game
but did everything you could to fix it such as:
1. Click reconnect multiple times
2. Re-login to your league of legends client
3. Restart your machine
and still had no fix? Then later receive a penalty for going AFK in-game?
I have a suggestion which may fix part of the issue.

**There needs to be some kind of point system for people who are unable to connect.**
Fair enough, if someone disconnects because they don't like their team or another part of the game, give them the penalty. But to players which are repeating 1-3 they should gain "AFK points" which accumulate the more of those they try. If by the time they reconnect or the game finishes and they have enough of these points, a leaver tag should not be added to the player.
And yes, the team will still suffer for the player which isn't in the game but **why punish the player when they're doing the best they can...**

**Additionally**, if the player goes AFK give them an option as to whether or not they wish to deny it (for genuine connection issues) - and be forced to play _and  win_ a few bot games without going AFK or something similar to ensure their connection works again before going back to PVP - or accept it (for people who forgot to take their cat for a walk that day) - and accept the current AFK punishment system.

I'm just saying, I've had this happen a few times and it wasn't fair to me so it definitely isn't fair to anyone else.

replies.body:
Firstly: It's the players responsibility to ensure they have a stable enough connection to play. It's also the players responsibility to ensure their computer meets the hardware/software requirements of the game. This is stated in the TOU and EULA. If you are disconnecting because of issues that arise from this it's your own fault. That simple.
Secondly: In order to be hit with leavebuster punishments you would need to leave games *consistently*. If you are DCing often enough for that to happen, regardless why the DCs occur, it's your own fault. That simple.
Thirdly: Ultimately, it doesn't matter why a DC occurred. Whatever the reason it's disadvantaged 4 other people and ruined the game for as many as 9. Should the system be more lenient? No. Why should other people suffer in-game because *some people* don't check their computer and connection are up to scratch?
Lastly: Playing the "it's not fair" card doesn't work here. It's Riot's game, Riot makes and maintains it, Riot make the rules, Riot determined what's fair. End of story.

♥ this.
It seems like common sense but so many people are incapable of grasping this concept.

Person1 leaves because his net, or his pc, crashes.
Person2 leaves because he pulled a plug or flipped a switch.

Devise a system able to tell the difference between Person1 and Person2, and i'll do all i can to convince Riot to implement it.
Till then...

Can't help you there, however:
_Person1_ gets pissed at his team and quits the game.
_Person2_ gets bugsplat or has file errors in his game and is constantly clicking reconnect.

Suggesting _Person2_ gains **1 point** each time they click reconnect or relogs his client, allow him exempt from being considered a "leaver" if he reaches **5 points**.

i like this idea but i feel like its gonna go unnoticed by riot along with the rest of the leaverbuster posts bc it seems like its a case of "what we say goes deal with it" which i can respect considering they made the game and all but i do wish theyd be more considerate sometimes

I do agree because my internet has been a bit shady and i have rung my isp multiple times and someone from chorus has come to our house to inspect the line etc and nothing has worked. if the net doesn't drop from that i occasionally get errors or firewall bullshit which is really annoying because i hate afkers and would never intentionally afk myself and always try to get back into the game asap
